reasoning: HSV is extremely common globally. Prevalence: HSV-1 ~67% of adults <50 years (WHO 2012 estimate for global burden), HSV-2 ~11% globally = combined ~67,000 per 100k prevalence. Incidence of new infections: estimated 1-2% of susceptible population annually, roughly 1,500 per 100k person-years for primary infections (combining HSV-1 and HSV-2). This is somewhat of an umbrella term (HSV-1 vs HSV-2 have different epidemiology), reducing confidence. Data quality strong for prevalence, moderate for incidence.
source: Looker KJ et al. (2015). Global estimates of prevalent and incident herpes simplex virus type 2 infections in 2012. PLoS One. 10(1):e114989
